data.message:
Going all the way back to the 1870's for Throwback Thursday!

In this photo from the archives, Nils and Diderikke Brandt and their family pose in front of Campus House. The building is one of the oldest that is still standing at Luther! #tbt #luthercollege

Professor Lee shares thoughts on how developing and improving a program helped him to realize that taking things apart and looking at them on a smaller scale can help us to enjoy the relationships we build with one another. 

Read more at: bit.ly/2ooa5Yt

Interested in spending a semester abroad? Each spring, Luther students get to experience what island life is like in Malta. Resting in the middle of the Mediterranean, Malta is a crossroads for European, Middle Eastern and African culture. In addition to taking Paideia and courses at the University of Malta, the group will travel to Rome, Morocco and Croatia during the spring 2018 semester. Any students interested in the Malta program should contact Corby Preus or Professor Paul Gardner. 

More information about the program can be found at: http://www.luther.edu/global-learning/apply/luther/semester/malta/

pc: Mo Speer

Congratulations to Luther College Associate Professor of German Elizabeth Steding! Steding has been awarded a Fulbright U.S. Scholar grant to conduct research and teach in Münster, Germany during the 2018 spring semester. 

Read more about Steding at: http://bit.ly/2pCbYVy

Come see the Luther College Varsity Band and Luther's Wind and Percussion Ensemble's spring concert at 7:00 p.m. Wednesday, April 19, in the CFL.

Read more about the concert at: bit.ly/2oOGtVe
Professor Joyce shares a composition based on one of Luther's many hymns in commemoration of the 500th anniversary of the Reformation.
Hey Norse, have you gotten your ticket for X Ambassadors yet? The concert is at 8 p.m. (doors open at 7:15 p.m.) this Friday, April 21 in the Regents Center #SACconcerts #luthercollege
Good morning, Norse Nation!
Happy Easter, Norse! #luthercollege
Congratulations to the winners of the German department's Martin Luther photo contest! Thank you to all the students who participated.
#HeyNorse, we're so "happy" that it's Easter break! Enjoy your well-deserved time off. #luthercollege

Congratulations to Bakhita Gonçalves Soares and William Jeide! The Luther College juniors have been selected as Peace Scholars for the 2016-17 academic year. The pair will spend seven weeks this summer studying peace and conflict resolution in Lillehammer and Oslo, Norway.

Read more about Gonçalves Soares and Jeide here: bit.ly/2o6Qqfq

This last Sunday the Luther Men's Track team gathered for a pizza party courtesy of Alumni and Development. The men's track team had the most donors on #luthergives17 and was the winner of the Sail Norse Challenge.

Having worked in the thick of the migrant crisis in Europe, Benjamin M. Stoltenburg, Ph.D., an instructor of language and cultural integration strategies from Münster, Germany, will deliver a lecture titled "The European Refugee Crisis-Germany's Answer" at 6:30 p.m. Wednesday, April 12, in Olin 102. 

https://www.luther.edu/headlines/?story_id=753026
You are welcome here.

A big congratulations is in order for Luther College graduate Erin Alberty '01, the lead reporter for the Salt Lake Tribune's team who was just awarded the Pulitzer Prize for its groundbreaking investigation of rapes at Utah colleges. You make us proud!

Stop by the Union today for our annual Thank-a-Donor Day from 9:30am-2:30pm. Each year the Annual Fund helps to enhance the Luther experience for all students across campus. Now is your time to say thanks!

p.s. There will be donuts!

Kevin Honz '18, has been awarded two prestigious scholarships for the 2017-18 academic year: the Rossing Physics Scholarship and the Goldwater Scholarship. 

Further details can be found at: luther.edu/headlines/?story_id=753259

"Do we want to produce students that function like machines, or do we strive to provide an academic environment that fosters engaged and self-aware citizens of the world who are sensitive to the moral questions of our times? These are the challenges. Now, it is our responsibility to respond to them."

Religion Professor Gereon Kopf shares his thoughts on protecting the liberals arts.

https://www.luther.edu/ideas-creations-blog/?story_id=753313

Expedia has named Decorah the most beautiful town in Iowa. 

Can't say we are too surprised, we love Decorah, too. 

https://viewfinder.expedia.com/features/beautiful-towns-50-states/
It's #NationalPetDay and we want to see Luther Nation's pets... send us or comment a picture of your pet geared up in it's favorite Norse gear! #luthercollege

News on something you've all been waiting for... our Luther College Chamber Orchestra will be performing at 4 p.m. Sunday, April 30th in the Main Hall of the Center for Faith and Life on the Luther campus. Come one, come all! https://www.luther.edu/headlines/?story_id=753545

Luigi Enriquez, Luther College senior from Racine, Wisconsin, is the 2016-17 recipient of the Alan R. and Sally J. Brudos Family Opera Prize. As part of the award, Enriquez will perform a recital at 4 p.m. Saturday, April 22, in the Noble Recital Hall of the Jenson-Noble Hall of Music on the Luther campus.

https://www.luther.edu/headlines/?story_id=753110

What do you appreciate the most about your siblings? Tag them in the comments and we'll spread a little #lutherlove! We've had a great time sharing our favorite photo submissions with you for National Sibling Day. #gonorse #luthersibs
#HeyNorse, tell us about a time with your siblings that you'll always remember! Enjoy more of our favorite photo submissions for National Sibling Day. #gonorse #luthersibs
